net.sf.mmm.music.datatype.api

Enum TonePitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TonePitch>
      • net.sf.mmm.music.datatype.api.TonePitch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<TonePitch>, Transposable<TonePitch>

    public enum TonePitch
extends Enum<TonePitch>
implements Transposable<TonePitch>
    This enum represents the TonePitch of a musical note. It is based on the twelve tone music system and only represents a single octave instead of an absolute pitch value.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      A
      A is nine semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      AIS
      A♯ (A#) is the sharpened enharmonic change of B_FLAT.
      AISIS
      A𝄪 (A##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of H.
      AS
      A♭ (Ab) is the flattened enharmonic change of GIS.
      ASES
      A𝄫 (Abb) is the flattened enharmonic change of G.
      B_FLAT
      B♭ (Bb) is ten semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      C
      C is the tonika (base tone) of the common MusicalKey.C_MAJOR key.
      CES
      C♭ (Cb) is the flattened enharmonic change of H.
      CESES
      C𝄫 (Cbb) is the flattened enharmonic change of B_FLAT.
      CIS
      C♯ (C#) is a semitone (half step) higher than the pitch C.
      CISIS
      C𝄪 (C##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of D.
      D
      D is two semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      DES
      D♭ (Db) is the flattened enharmonic change of CIS.
      DESES
      D𝄫 (Dbb) is the flattened enharmonic change of C.
      DIS
      D♯ (D#) is the sharpened enharmonic change of ES.
      DISIS
      D𝄪 (D##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of E.
      E
      E is four semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      EIS
      E♯ (E#) is the sharpened enharmonic change of F.
      EISIS
      E𝄪 (E##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of FIS.
      ES
      E♭ (Eb) is three semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      ESES
      D𝄫 (Ebb) is the flattened enharmonic change of D.
      F
      F is five semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      FES
      F♭ (Fb) is the flattened enharmonic change of E.
      FESES
      F𝄫 (Fbb) is the flattened enharmonic change of ES.
      FIS
      F♯ (Fis) is six semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      FISIS
      F𝄪 (F##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of G.
      G
      G is seven semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      GES
      G♭ (Gb) is the flattened enharmonic change of FIS.
      GESES
      G𝄫 (Gbb) is the flattened enharmonic change of F.
      GIS
      G♯ (G#) is eight semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      GISIS
      G𝄪 (G##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of A.
      H
      B♮ is eleven semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C.
      HESES
      H𝄫 (Hbb) is the flattened enharmonic change of A.
      HIS
      H♯ (H#) is the sharpened enharmonic change of C.
      HISIS
      H𝄪 (H##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of CIS.

        public static final TonePitch C

      • AS

        public static final TonePitch AS
        A♭ (Ab) is the flattened enharmonic change of GIS.

      • A

        public static final TonePitch A
        A is nine semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. The middle a (a1, Concert A reference) is normalized to 440Hz.

      • GISIS

        public static final TonePitch GISIS
        G𝄪 (G##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of A.

      • HESES

        public static final TonePitch HESES
        H𝄫 (Hbb) is the flattened enharmonic change of A.

      • B_FLAT

        public static final TonePitch B_FLAT
        B♭ (Bb) is ten semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. In most countries this pitch is simply called B. See H for further details.

      • AIS

        public static final TonePitch AIS
        A♯ (A#) is the sharpened enharmonic change of B_FLAT.

      • CESES

        public static final TonePitch CESES
        C𝄫 (Cbb) is the flattened enharmonic change of B_FLAT.

      • H

        public static final TonePitch H
        B♮ is eleven semitones (half steps) higher than the pitch C. In most countries this pitch is simply called H. However the Americans use B instead of H what can cause confusion with B_FLAT. The international notation therefore suggests the following notation:
        International American European
        B♮ B H
        B♭ B♭ B

      • AISIS

        public static final TonePitch AISIS
        A𝄪 (A##) is the sharpened enharmonic change of H.

      • CES

        public static final TonePitch CES
        C♭ (Cb) is the flattened enharmonic change of H.

      • getStep

        public int getStep()
        Returns:
        the number of half-tone steps upwards from C.

      • getUnicode

        public String getUnicode()
        Returns:
        the short title using unicode characters for musical symbols (E.g. "B♮" or "E♭").

      • getAscii

        public String getAscii()
        Returns:
        the short title using ASCII characters for musical symbols (E.g. "C#" or "Eb").

      • getText

        public String getText()
        Returns:
        the title as plain text without musical symbols as plain ASCII (E.g. "Cis" or "Es").

      • isSharp

        public boolean isSharp()
        Returns:
        true if this TonePitch requires a single (♯) or double (𝄪) sharp sign, false otherwise.

      • isFlat

        public boolean isFlat()
        Returns:
        true if this TonePitch requires a single (♭) or double (𝄫) sharp sign, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Enum<TonePitch>

      • getNormal

        public TonePitch getNormal()
        Returns:
        the normal form of this TonePitch in case this is an enharmonic change or this TonePitch itself if it is already normal.

      • isNormal

        public boolean isNormal()
        Returns:
        true if this is the normal form (that would be used in MusicalKey.C_MAJOR), false in case of an enharmonic change.

      • getInterval

        public ChromaticInterval getInterval(TonePitch targetTone)
        Parameters:
        targetTone - is the target TonePitch.
        Returns:
        the ChromaticInterval to get from this TonePitch to the given targetTone.

      • transposeChromatic

        public TonePitch transposeChromatic(int semitoneSteps,
                                    EnharmonicStyle style)
        Description copied from interface: Transposable
        This method transposes this object by the given number of semitoneSteps wrapping TonePitches within the chromatic scale and using the given style for enharmonic changes.
        Specified by:
        transposeChromatic in interface Transposable<TonePitch>
        Parameters:
        semitoneSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose. A positive value transposes towards a higher pitch, a negative value transposes towards a lower pitch. A value of zero (0) will cause no change of the step. TonePitches will wrap modulo 12.
        style - the EnharmonicStyle.
        Returns:
        the transposed and normalized instance.

      • transposeChromatic

        public TonePitch transposeChromatic(int semitoneSteps,
                                    MusicalKey targetKey)
        Description copied from interface: Transposable
        This method transposes this object by the given number of semitoneSteps wrapping TonePitches within the chromatic scale of the given MusicalKey.
        Specified by:
        transposeChromatic in interface Transposable<TonePitch>
        Parameters:
        semitoneSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose. A positive value transposes towards a higher pitch, a negative value transposes towards a lower pitch. A value of zero (0) will cause no change of the step. TonePitches will wrap modulo 12.
        targetKey - is the target key.
        Returns:
        the transposed TonePitch with enharmonic change according to the given MusicalKey.
        See Also:
        Transposable.transposeChromatic(int, EnharmonicStyle)

      • transposeDiatonic

        public TonePitch transposeDiatonic(int diatonicSteps,
                                   MusicalKey targetKey)
        Description copied from interface: Transposable
        This method transposes this object by the given number of diatonicSteps wrapping TonePitches within the diatonic scale of the given MusicalKey.
        Specified by:
        transposeDiatonic in interface Transposable<TonePitch>
        Parameters:
        diatonicSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose. A positive value transposes towards a higher pitch, a negative value transposes towards a lower pitch. A value of zero (0) will cause no change of the step. TonePitches will wrap modulo 8.
        targetKey - is the target key.
        Returns:
        the transposed instance with enharmonic change according to the given MusicalKey.
        See Also:
        Transposable.transposeChromatic(int, EnharmonicStyle)

      • transpose

        public TonePitch transpose(Interval interval,
                           MusicalKey targetKey)
        Description copied from interface: Transposable
        Transposes this object by the given Interval within the given MusicalKey.
        Specified by:
        transpose in interface Transposable<TonePitch>
        Parameters:
        interval - is the Interval such as e.g. Solmization.MI, ChromaticInterval.MAJOR_THIRD, or DiatonicInterval.THIRD.
        targetKey - is the target key.
        Returns:
        the transposed instance.

      • fromString

        public static TonePitch fromString(String title)
        This method gets the TonePitch for the given title.
        Parameters:
        title - is the title of the TonePitch which is the unicode, ASCII or text representation in any case.
        Returns:
        the requested TonePitch or null if no such TonePitch exists.

      • fromStringAsPrefix

        public static String fromStringAsPrefix(String string)
        This method gets the TonePitch that represents the longest prefix of the given string ignoring the case. E.g. for "aSeS4" it would return ASES and for "Asis" it would return AS.
        Parameters:
        string - is a String supposed to start with the title of the TonePitch which is the unicode, ASCII or text representation in any case.
        Returns:
        the requested TonePitch or null if no such TonePitch exists.

      • getTonePrefix

        public static String getTonePrefix(String string)
        This method gets the longest string representation of the TonePitch that is a prefix of the given string ignoring the case. E.g. for "aSeS4" it would return "ases" and for "Asis" it would return "as".
        Parameters:
        string - is a String supposed to start with the title of the TonePitch which is the unicode, ASCII or text representation in any case.
        Returns:
        the requested TonePitch or null if no such TonePitch exists.
        See Also:
        fromStringAsPrefix(String)

      • getFlatSignTones

        public static List<TonePitch> getFlatSignTones()
        Returns:
        the List of (single) flat sign tones in the order of the circle of fifths.

      • getSharpSignTones

        public static List<TonePitch> getSharpSignTones()
        Returns:
        the List of (single) sharp sign tones in the order of the circle of fifths.
